means: 不够和善的，残酷的，欠考虑的( unkind的最高级 )

sentence.Network_en: His unkindest cut at Elizabeth was to call her heartless.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对伊丽莎白最无情的伤害就是说她“残酷无情”.

sentence.Network_en: This was the unkindest cut of all!
sentence.Network_cn: 这比任何打击都厉害些呀!

entry.tran: 不仁慈的；不友善的；不厚道的；刻薄的
entry.def: If someone is unkind, they behave in an unpleasant, unfriendly, or slightly cruel way. You can also describe someone's words or actions as unkind .

example.ex: All last summer he'd been unkind to her...
example.tran: 去年整个夏天他都对她很恶劣。

example.ex: No one has an unkind word to say about him...
example.tran: 所有人说起他来都没有一句坏话。

entry.def: If you describe something bad that happens to someone as unkind, you mean that they do not deserve it.

example.ex: The weather was unkind to those pipers who played in the morning.
example.tran: 坏天气对上午那些风笛吹奏者毫不容情。

example.ex: ...a shared conviction that some unkind fate or chance is keeping them apart.
example.tran: 彼此坚信是无情的命运或机缘让他们一再错过

auth_sentence.content: This article was published in print as The Unkindest Cut.
auth_sentence.res_content: This article was published in print as The Unkindest Cut.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This article was published in print as The Unkindest Cut.

auth_sentence.content: In the unkindest cut, Sandy, Philip's adored big brother, defects.
auth_sentence.res_content: In the unkindest cut, Sandy, Philip's adored big brother, defects.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In the unkindest cut, Sandy, Philip's adored big brother, defects.
